full_summary:
================

### Title

**Notice of Invitation to Tender: Web Scraping Services for Illicit Psychoactive Substances**

### Reference

Reference Number: cb-538-85166515

Amendment Number: 4
Solicitation Number: 1000252079
Publication Date: 2024-01-29

### Background and Overview

Health Canada is soliciting proposals for web scraping services to identify the availability and use of illicit psychoactive substances. This requirement supports Health Canada's surveillance and monitoring activities for drugs.

### Scope of Work

The successful proponent will be responsible for:

* Web scraping services to identify the availability and use of illicit psychoactive substances
* Providing monthly reports and data deliverables to the Project Authority on the last Friday of every month (with the exception of the final month of the project)
* Delivering reports and data in an electronic format

### Project Timeline

The project is scheduled to start on April 1st, 2024, and will end on March 31st, 2028.

### Estimated Contract Value

The estimated value of this requirement is between $0 and $2,000,000.

### Security Requirements

There are no security requirements associated with this requirement.

### Evaluation Criteria

The selection criteria for the successful proponent will be the highest combined rating of technical merit and price.

### Solicitation Documents

For further information and access to the proposal (RFP) notices, please review the Buyandsell.gc.ca site.

### Attachments

RFP notice: [https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/30716/health-canada-rfp-1000252079_1.pdf](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/30716/health-canada-rfp-1000252079_1.pdf)

### Contact Information

Contact Person: Beverly Shawana
Contact Email: [beverly.shawana@hc-sc.gc.ca](mailto:beverly.shawana@hc-sc.gc.ca)
Contact Phone: 613-915-0113
Contact Fax: N/A

Note:
We converted sections for easier navigation and readability, rewrote paragraphs, rephrased sentences, and encapsulated text for emphasis on key information.
